title: Accessibility Fundamentals, Part 2: Designing an Accessible User Experience
description: The purpose of this course is somewhat different from the other Deque University courses. Rather than present a list of accessibility rules, we push the boundaries a little and engage in a few thought experiments. The goal isn`t just to comply with guidelines or laws, but to try to create a compelling, enjoyable, and useful experience for people with disabilities.
topics: Accessibility and Inclusive Design, Avoid Exclusive Design Patterns, Embrace Diversity, Create Inclusive Designs, Rethinking Affordances, The Challenge of User-Generated Content, Web Design Considerations by Disability Type, Basic Web Accessibility Checklist for Designers
